> **Status:** Early development
> APIs, syntax, and internal architecture may change without notice.

<h2 align="center">
  Phynix is a modern, high-performance superset of PHP that introduces PHX, 
  a modern language mode for enhanced web development.
</h2>

<p align="center">
  ‚ö†Ô∏è <strong>Work in progress</strong> ‚Äî the lexer for PHP is largely complete,
  the parser is under active development, and many features are not yet stable.
</p>

<p align="center">
  üìç See <a href="./ROADMAP.md"><strong>ROADMAP.md</strong></a> for current status
  and planned milestones.
</p>

## Installation

Phynix is currently under heavy development and not yet production-ready.
At this stage it is intended for experimentation, testing, and contributor
feedback only.

You can build it from source using Cargo:

```shell
git clone https://github.com/phynix-lang/phynix.git
cd phynix
cargo build --release
```

# Usage

## üìñ List of contents

- [Key Features](#key-features)

    - [Testing](#testing)
- [License](#license)

## Key Features

<details open>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>

- **Superset of PHP**: Full compatibility with existing PHP codebases with
  enhanced diagnostics and performance.
- **PHX Language Mode**: A powerful syntax bringing strict typing and modern
  constructs to PHP.
- **Unified Ecosystem**: Seamlessly mix `.php` and `.phx` files within the same
  project.
- **High-Performance Rust Core**: Lexer and parser built from the ground up in
  Rust for zero-cost abstractions and extreme speed.
- **Advanced Error Recovery**: Parser designed to produce usable ASTs and
  precise diagnostics even from broken code.

</details>

## Project Structure

<details>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>

Phynix is organized into several specialized crates within a Rust workspace:

- **phynix-core**: Common types, diagnostics system, and shared utilities.
- **phynix-lex**: High-speed lexer supporting PHP and PHX modes.
- **phynix-parse**: Pratt-based parser for expressions and table-driven for
  statements.
- **phynix-analyze**: Semantic analysis, type checking, and symbol resolution.
- **phynix-vm**: Tree-walking and bytecode-based runtime.
- **phynix-lsp**: Language Server Protocol implementation for IDE support.
- **phynix-cli**: Command-line interface for running, checking, and formatting
  code.
- **phynix-bench**: Performance benchmarking suite.

</details>

## Development

<details>
<summary>Click to expand</summary>

### Running Code

To run a PHP or PHX file using the CLI:

```shell
cargo run -p phynix-cli -- run path/to/file.php
```

### Checking Syntax

To check a file for syntax errors without executing it:

```shell
cargo run -p phynix-cli -- check path/to/file.phx
```

### Testing

Run the full test suite across all crates:

```shell
cargo test
```

For reviewing and updating parser snapshots:

```shell
cargo install cargo-insta
cargo insta review
```

</details>
